remarks: A lower bound on the ` CNF ` function.  Since ` ( ( A CNF B ) `` F ) ` is defined as the sum of ` ( A ^o x ) .o ( F `` x ) ` over all ` x ` in the support of ` F ` , it is larger than any of these terms (and all other terms are zero, so we can extend the statement to all ` C e. B ` instead of just those ` C ` in the support).  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-May-2015.)  (Revised by AV, 28-Jun-2019.)
statement:

cantnfle.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. B ) $.
cantnfle $p |- ( ph -> ( ( A ^o C ) .o ( F ` C ) ) C_ ( ( A CNF B ) ` F ) ) $.
